credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
title: Design for Bottom of a Bowl
description: Double head of two men, one of whom wears a fool's cap, in the center, embodying Pride and Foolishness, which form the theme of the representations in the outer circle: the wife upon the dragon of the Revelations of St. John; Phaeton's death; the original sin; Marcus Curtius jumping into the abyss; a woman with a looking glass; a peacock; monsters.  Inscriptions in Low German and French.
name: Print
